verses.roman:
līlā-sthala dekhi' preme ha-ilā asthira
balabhadra kaila tāṅre mathurāra bāhira

synonyms: līlā-sthala—all the holy places of Lord Kṛṣṇa's pastimes; dekhi'-visiting; preme—in great ecstasy; ha-ilā—became; asthira—agitated; balabhadra—of the name Balabhadra; kaila—assisted; tāṅre—Lord Caitanya Mahāprabhu; mathurāra—of the town of Mathurā; bāhira—outside.
translation: When Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu visited all twelve places of Śrī Kṛṣṇa's pastimes, He became very agitated because of ecstasy. Balabhadra Bhaṭṭācārya somehow or other got Him out of Mathurā.
